classes

Class Post

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Post

  • public class Post
extends java.lang.Object
    Objects of this class represents posts of users on their profil or in a group. Posts have an owner and an author, where the owner is a group and the author is a user. If the user didn't post within a group the flag groupPost is false.
    Author:
    johannes

    • Method Detail

      • convertPostListToJson

        public static javax.json.JsonValue convertPostListToJson(java.util.List<Post> postList,
                                                         java.lang.Boolean newsfeed)
                                                  throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                         java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Converts any list of posts to a json string
        Parameters:
        postList - any list of posts
        Returns:
         {
   "postList": [
     {
       "content":"content text",
       "id":postID number,
       "owner":owenerID number,
       "postDate":timestamp number,
       "upVotes": [
         {
           "date":timestamp number,
           "voter":voterID number
         },
       ],
       "visibility":true/false
     },
   ],
   "successful":true
 }
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

        public void createInDB()
                throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                       java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a post with ownerID, authorID, content, and privacy status into db. this.author and this.owner with at least the id value, this.content and this.privatePost needs to be given.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getComments

        public java.util.Map<java.util.AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<User,java.lang.Integer>,java.util.AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<java.lang.String,java.util.Date>> getComments()
        Simple getter for comments. Comments should've been a seperate class
        • the key of the key is the commentator
        • the value of the key is the comment id (from `Comments` table in db)
        • the key of the value is the content
        • the value of the key is the date of creation
        Returns:
        this.comments

                                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                              java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Gets comments as Json
        Returns:
         {
   "commentList": [
     {
       "id":commentID,
       "date":commentDate number,
       "author":{
         "firstName":"firstName text",
         "lastName":"name text",
         "username":"username text"
       },
       "content":"content text"
     },
   ],
   "successful":true
 }

      • removeComment

        public Post removeComment(int commentID,
                          User user)
                   throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                          java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                          java.sql.SQLException
        Remove a comment. Uses 1 select and 1 delete query
        Parameters:
        commentID -
        user - - the spectating user. Needed to check, if he is allowed to delete the comment. A comment can be deleted by its author or the author of the post.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
